title: Litecoin Whale Deposits 500,000 LTC To Binance: Price Decline To Extend?
body: On-chain data shows a Litecoin whale has made a huge deposit to the cryptocurrency exchange Binance in the past day, a sign that could be bearish for LTC‚Äôs price. Binance Has Just Received A Massive Litecoin Inflow According to data from the cryptocurrency transaction tracker service Whale Alert, a large move has been spotted on the Litecoin network during the last 24 hours. The transfer in question involved the shifting of 500,000 LTC across the network. At the time that the chain executed the transaction, this stack was worth around $51.3 million. Given the large scale associated with the move, it‚Äôs likely that a whale entity was responsible for it. Related Reading: Bitcoin‚Äôs Next Stop: $75,500? Analyst Reveals Historical ‚ÄòMagnet‚Äô Level Whales are the largest of investors on the network, who can carry some degree of influence in the market due to their ability to make large transactions like this latest one. As such, the behavior of these humongous holders can often be worth keeping an eye on, as even if it may not always end up impacting the LTC price, it can still tell us about what the sentiment is like among this important cohort. Generally, though, it can be hard to say for certain what the whales are doing from their transaction activity alone, considering the anonymous nature of the blockchain. Nonetheless, sometimes, one of the wallets involved in the transaction can be connected to a central entity, which can provide room for speculation. The latest Litecoin move is fortunately of this type. Here are the details of the addresses involved in the transfer: As is visible above, the whale made the Litecoin transaction from a few unknown wallets. Such addresses are those that aren‚Äôt known to be affiliated with any centralized platform, so they can be assumed to be personal, self-custodial wallets of the investor. The destination of the transaction was a wallet attached to Binance, an exchange. Moves of this type, where coins go from personal addresses to the custody of an exchange, are known as exchange inflows. Related Reading: Solana (SOL) Crashes 15% After Massive Profit-Taking Spike Usually, investors deposit their tokens to these platforms when they want to use one of the services that they require, which can include selling. As such, exchange inflows can sometimes have a bearish impact on the asset‚Äôs price. It‚Äôs unknown, though, whether the whale truly intended to sell with the latest exchange inflow or not. In the scenario that the investor did plan for it, then it could spell trouble for Litecoin, considering the scale of the move and the fact that its price has already registered a considerable drawdown during the past week. LTC Price Litecoin has recently plummeted alongside the rest of the cryptocurrency sector, which has brought its price down to $104. Featured image from Dall-E, whale-alert.io, chart from TradingView.com
tags: Litecoin|Binance|litecoin bearish|litecoin price|Litecoin Price Decline|Litecoin Whale|Litecoin Whale Deposit|ltc|LTCUSDT

title: Bitwise Files S-1 for Aptos (APT) ETF, Token Sees 18% Price Surge
body: Bitwise, a crypto ETF issuer, has filed an S-1 registration statement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that tracks the price of Aptos (APT), the native token of the Aptos network. This move follows Bitwise's recent filing to create a Delaware trust entity for the proposed Aptos ETF, which is based on the scalable layer 1 blockchain token utilizing the Move programming language. The filing of the S-1 document is a crucial step towards launching the ETF, as it is required for companies seeking to issue a new security and list it on a public stock exchange. Additionally, a 19b-4 filing will be necessary to signal a requisite rule change at the stock exchange seeking to list the investment. APT saw an 18% increase in its price over the past 24 hours, trading at $6.48 at the time of the filing, as reported by Helene Braun of CoinDesk. title: Retail Trading Giant Robinhood Lists Ethereum Layer-2 Arbitrum, Triggering Rally for ARB
body: An Ethereum ( ETH ) layer-2 scaling solution is soaring after gaining support from US retail trading giant Robinhood. According to Robinhood, the ETH layer-2 Arbitrum ( ARB ) is now available to be bought, sold, and traded over the trading platform. google336x280] News of the addition sent ARB rallying from a price of $0.374 on March 4th to $0.421 a day later. It has since stabilized and is trading for $0.419 at time of writing, a 14.5% gain during the last 24 hours. ARB joins Robinhood‚Äôs suite of crypto products, which includes Bitcoin ( BTC ), Ethereum, Cardano ( ADA ), Solana ( SOL ), popular memecoins such as Dogecoin ( DOGE ), Pepe ( PEPE ) and Shiba Inu ( SHIB ), and dozens of others. Last month, it was Robinhood reported that it saw a staggering 8x increase in crypto trading revenue in Q4 of 2024, putting pressure on Coinbase, its competitor and the largest crypto exchange platform in the US. According to the Robinhood‚Äôs investment report, the company saw a 200% year-over-year increase in transaction-based revenues, most of which can be attributed to crypto. In February, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) dropped its investigation into Robinhood without levying any enforcement actions against the firm. As stated by Dan Gallagher, the Robinhood‚Äôs chief legal, compliance and corporate affairs officer, at the time, ‚ÄúWe applaud the staff‚Äôs decision to close this investigation with no action. Let me be crystal clear ‚Äì this investigation never should have been opened. Robinhood Crypto always has and will always respect federal securities laws and never allowed transactions in securities. As we explained to the SEC, any case against Robinhood Crypto would have failed. We appreciate the formal closing of this investigation, and we are happy to see a return to the rule of law and commitment to fairness at the SEC.‚Äù Don't Miss a Beat ‚Äì Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Belarus Looking Into Crypto Mining Following Trump's Reserve Plans
body: The President of Belarus, Aleksandr Lukashenko, raised the possibility yesterday that the Eastern European country could begin mining cryptocurrencies. "Look at this mining. More and more people are turning to me. If it is profitable for us, let's do it. We have excess electricity. Let them make this cryptocurrency and so on," Lukashenko told Alexei Kushnarenko, the nation's new minister of energy, according to Belarusian media outlet Belta . The news comes as the U.S. government is studying the possibility of creating a national strategic crypto reserve that could include cryptocurrencies such as bitcoin (BTC), ether (ETH), solana (SOL), ripple (XRP) and cardano (ADA). Lukashenko mentioned the White House's interest in crypto. "You see the path the world is going. And especially the largest economy in the world. They announced yesterday that they will keep [a crypto] reserve," he said. "Therefore, there will be demand for them. Well, maybe we should do it ourselves," Lukashenko said . Belarus wouldn't be the first nation to mine cryptocurrencies. The Kingdom of Bhutan, with its abundance of hydropower, already has more than 100 megawatts (MW) of operational bitcoin mining infrastructure and is set to get another 500MW worth of power online. The country currently holds $950 million in bitcoin, according to Arkham Intelligence El Salvador, for its part, uses geothermal energy to mine bitcoin, though in smaller quantities.Disclaimer: The information in this article was translated using Google Translate from a foreign language source.

title: Will Base's Flashblocks Update Beat Solana?
body: Base, the Ethereum Layer 2 blockchain of centralized crypto exchange Coinbase, has become twice as fast compared to Solana following a recent network upgrade, Base creator Jesse Pollak in a Feb. 28 X post . On Feb. 27, Base unveiled several network upgrades , including flashblocks, a technology based on Solana and Celestia‚Äôs architecture that introduces 200-millisecond preconfirmation blocks, making Base the fastest Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). However, the idea that this development makes Base outright faster than Solana has sparked debate. While Pollak made this claim, critics were quick to push back. title: Trump omits crypto in congress speech, signaling it‚Äôs not a priority, says TD Cowen
body: Investment bank TD Cowen noted that President Donald Trump did not mention cryptocurrency in his Congress speech on Tuesday night, despite his recent comments on the industry. According to TD Cowen‚Äôs Washington Research Group, led by Jaret Seiberg , this omission indicates that crypto is not a personal priority for Trump. ‚ÄúIf it was a personal priority, then it would have been in the speech,‚Äù Seiberg wrote in a note on Wednesday. Trump sidelines crypto in speech, signaling political strategy or low priority The exclusion particularly stood out since Trump had referenced crypto in prior speeches and on social media just days before the Congress address, according to Seiberg. He views the exclusion as ‚Äúmore substantive‚Äù than Trump‚Äôs silence on other topics like housing and banking, given that the president does have a crypto strategy. Seiberg highlighted a political rationale for Trump‚Äôs omission of crypto in the speech, noting that congressional Republicans seek Democratic support for stablecoin legislation in the coming months. Trump‚Äôs involvement could complicate that effort. However, he also proposed a more nuanced reason ‚Äî Trump does not view crypto as a central issue in his broader political agenda. ‚ÄúTrump talks up crypto when he is before crypto investors. Yet we continue to believe this is not a personal priority,‚Äù Seiberg said. Generally, Trump‚Äôs speech was ‚Äúlong on showmanship and short on substance for even a Donald Trump address,‚Äù according to Seiberg. ‚ÄúAs many commentators noted last night, the address more resembled a campaign rally speech than a State of the Union speech.‚Äù The White House is set to hold its first Crypto Summit on Friday, led by Trump‚Äôs crypto czar, David Sacks. Industry leaders such as Michael Saylor and Brian Armstrong are expected to attend, with reports suggesting the event may reveal details about a U.S. crypto reserve. Crypto prices rally after Trump backs five coins for ‚ÄòCrypto reserve The president‚Äôs address, spanning a record 99 minutes, served as a defiant sales pitch for the policies Trump championed during his campaign and doubled down on in his first weeks back in office. He vowed to continue enacting sweeping changes to rescue the nation from what he described as his predecessor‚Äôs destruction and missteps. Throughout the speech, he rarely addressed the American people directly, who are grappling with recent upheavals, while repeatedly taking jabs at the Democratic lawmakers seated before him. Michigan Sen. Elissa Slotkin, who delivered the Democratic response after Trump‚Äôs speech, said, ‚ÄúAmerica wants change, but there‚Äôs a responsible way to make change and a reckless way, and we can make that change without forgetting who we are as a country and as a democracy.‚Äù Though Trump did not mention cryptocurrency in his Congressional speech on Tuesday night, he recently revealed the names of five cryptocurrencies that he says he‚Äôd like to be included in a new strategic reserve to make the US ‚Äúthe Crypto Capital of the World. ‚Äú The market prices of the five coins he named ‚Äì Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP, Solana and Cardano ‚Äì swiftly jumped after the announcement. During Trump‚Äôs presidential campaign, he aggressively courted the crypto community. The previous US president, Joe Biden, had overseen a crypto crackdown due to fraud and money laundering concerns. title: Singapore officials warn against crypto
body: The Singapore Minister of State for Home Affairs, Sun Xueling, has urged the population not to invest in cryptocurrencies as the number of associated scams has increased. Speaking in parliament on the 4th of March, she noted that the regulation of cryptocurrency is complicated due to its anonymous features and is advantageous to criminals. ‚ÄúOur advice to the public is to stay away from cryptocurrencies. The risk of getting burned is high, and if you become a victim of a scam, the chances of getting any of your money back are slim,‚Äù said Sun Xueling. Singaporeans suffered 1.1 billion yuan losses from scams last year, 70% more than in the same period last year. Such frauds included those involving cryptocurrency and contributed to a quarter of the losses incurred. With the increased use of cryptocurrencies, criminals are now using it to compel victims to withdraw their money into digital money so that it can hardly be traced. Cybercriminals and phishing attacks have also led to the loss of money from users‚Äô digital wallets. Though the Monetary Authority of Singapore regulates local crypto operations under the Payment Services Act, most exchanges and wallets are outside its jurisdiction. Sun remarked that even professional investors have fallen to the tricks of these fraudsters. Calls for tougher fraud penalties The question as to whether penalties for fraud should be more severe was also discussed. Jurong GRC MP Dr Tan Yew Meng opined that Singapore has overly lenient laws at present. While moneylenders who handle $10,000 worth of illicit money face caning, fraudsters who steal much larger sums can go scot-free. He even advocated for compulsory caning in cases where the fraud offence is considered severe. His statements demonstrate a rising concern that regulators have voiced in recent years about the rising number of crypto scams. Sun reported that at present, the government is examining the legislative measures against fraud and increasing some of the offences that can attract caning. She mentioned that more than 80% of the victims of the scam willingly transferred the money to the fraudster through impersonation, pretence of authority or fake promises of financial gains. To reduce this threat, the Singapore government has recently passed the Anti-Fraud Protection Bill. The law, however, allows authorities to block the assets of such victims in case they do not heed the threats. It is anticipated that this should be implemented this year. However, to date, there has not been a policy amendment with regard to some of these concerns. But it should be noted that according to local media reports, new regulations might be introduced soon. However, despite the fraud cases, cryptocurrency use is rising in Singapore.¬†Singapore‚Äôs central bank¬†doubled the number of licenses in the market in 2024 to improve stability. title: SEC and CFTC Make Unexpected Statement on Cryptocurrency Enforcement: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre Not Walking Away‚Äù ‚Äì What Does It Mean?
body: Senior enforcement officials from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) have reaffirmed their commitment to policing market abuse, despite the Trump administration‚Äôs ongoing efforts to restructure federal agencies. Speaking at an American Bar Association event in Miami today, SEC acting enforcement director Antonia Apps and CFTC enforcement director Brian Young noted that enforcement will remain a priority even amid broader policy changes. ‚ÄúYou can expect to see some changes depending on priorities and different policies that we may pursue,‚Äù Apps said, ‚Äúbut we will move forward with the core enforcement agenda that we have always moved forward with.‚Äù The statements come at a time when both regulatory agencies are undergoing significant transformations under Republican leadership. Since late January, the SEC has been reviewing its cryptocurrency enforcement policies, while the CFTC has been restructuring its enforcement division. Related News: Analytics Company Shares 7 "Most Negative" Altcoins According to Funding Rates The comments were made at a government enforcement conference focused on white-collar crime, where Justice Department officials reportedly withdrew from speaking because of ongoing changes and turmoil within the Justice Department. Both Apps and Young voiced strong support for enforcement personnel, who are facing mass layoffs and budget cuts as the administration, along with special adviser Elon Musk, seeks to reshape the federal workforce. ‚ÄúIn addition to doing a great job, the CFTC enforcement staff are genuinely good people,‚Äù Young said. ‚ÄúI think the taxpayers should be indebted to them for what they do for us every day.‚Äù Young also noted that the agency prioritizes cases that have a strong likelihood of returning funds to victims of fraud or market manipulation. One of the most notable policy changes came at the SEC, which has paused or dropped active litigation and investigations related to cryptocurrencies. When asked about the future of crypto enforcement, Apps reiterated that the agency will continue to pursue cases involving fraud and clear regulatory jurisdiction. ‚ÄúWe're not walking away,‚Äù he said. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: SEC and CFTC Make Unexpected Statement on Cryptocurrency Enforcement: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre Not Walking Away‚Äù ‚Äì What Does It Mean?

title: Russian Finance Ministry ‚ÄòWould Consider Building Crypto Reserve‚Äô ‚Äì On One Condition
body: The Russian Finance Ministry says it has no immediate plans to build a national strategic crypto reserve , but has claimed that this could change if a key condition is met. The ministry said the National Welfare Fund (NWF)‚Äôs level of liquid funds should be topped up to reach a level equivalent to 7-10% of Russia‚Äôs GDP before Moscow considers buying ‚Äúriskier‚Äù assets like crypto. Russian Crypto Reserve: Could Moscow Start Buying BTC? Per the Russian media outlets Interfax and RBC , the claims came from the Russian Deputy Finance Minister Vladimir Kolychev, who claimed that the ministry ‚Äúis not currently considering‚Äù buying or holding crypto in the NWF ‚Äúdue to its high volatility.‚Äù Vladimir Kolychev, the Russian Deputy Finance Minister. (Source: Katerina Vorontsova/YouTube/Screenshot) When questioned on the matter, Kolychev said that the ministry would ‚Äúnot‚Äù make changes in the structure of the NWF‚Äôs investments. He said that the fund would continue to focus exclusively on gold and Chinese yuan holdings. Media outlets say that 60% of the fund is made up of yuan, with the remaining 40% in gold reserves. Gold bars embossed with a stamp that reads ‚ÄúRussia.‚Äù (Source: Kapital Strany/YouTube/Screenshot) However, Kolychev said it would be ‚Äúpossible to consider riskier assets‚Äù when the NWF reaches Moscow‚Äôs 7%-10% target. ‚ÄúWhen we get there, we will be able to think about different assets, including crypto. However, for now, the volatility signs are not favorable.‚Äù Russian Deputy Finance Minister Vladimir Kolychev Kolychev added that Russia is still ‚Äúfar‚Äù from reaching its desired levels of reserves. And that is why Moscow will only countenance buying gold and yuan reserves for the time being. We Need Liquidity, Says Deputy Finance Chief The Deputy Finance Minister said the fund‚Äôs assets ‚Äúmust be liquid and not subject to sharp revaluations.‚Äù He added: ‚ÄúWhen we sell our reserves, the sales should not result in us receiving 50 kopeks for each ruble we invested, instead of a ruble for each ruble‚Äôs worth of our assets.‚Äù The comments come just months after Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov told university students who asked him about creating a Russian crypto reserve that the Treasury needed to ‚Äúearn less, but keep its powder dry.‚Äù Trump pivots to the war in Ukraine and his talks with Russia. Trump says he has gotten ‚Äústrong signals‚Äù from Russia that Moscow is ready for peace. ‚ÄúWouldn‚Äôt that be beautiful?‚Äù Trump asks. Latest updates: https://t.co/vDJlBJzZHe pic.twitter.com/kVlCxo25W9 ‚Äî Bloomberg (@business) March 5, 2025 Central Bank‚Äôs Final Say Kolychev concluded by saying that he was not party to any ‚Äúdiscussions about creating a cryptocurrency reserve in Russia‚Äù similar to Washington‚Äôs own strategic crypto reserve fund. He claimed that final decisions on such matters would be taken by the Russian Central Bank. As previously reported, the Russian Central Bank Governor Elvira Nabiullina is a known crypto-skeptic . Nabiullina has tried on multiple occasions to orchestrate a total, China-style ban on crypto in Russia. The post Russian Finance Ministry ‚ÄòWould Consider Building Crypto Reserve‚Äô ‚Äì On One Condition appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: How Ripple Escrow Safeguards XRP Price
body: Ripple‚Äôs escrow system has been a significant mechanism in managing XRP‚Äôs supply and maintaining market confidence. A recent post by cryptocurrency researcher SMQKE (@SMQKEDQG) emphasized how this system was implemented to eliminate uncertainty about XRP‚Äôs future supply and prevent concerns over centralized control. The discussion, accompanied by a highlighted excerpt from Ripple‚Äôs 2017 announcement, has reignited conversations about how XRP‚Äôs escrow functions and its broader implications. ‚ÄúRipple‚Äôs Escrow Safeguards XRP‚Äôs Price‚Äù Ripple‚Äôs escrow system was designed to eliminate uncertainty about XRP‚Äôs future supply. By locking up a significant portion of XRP, Ripple ensured the market wouldn‚Äôt be concerned about centralized control over its distribution. ‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/5fk9ZjQjkG ‚Äî SMQKE (@SMQKEDQG) March 3, 2025 The Purpose of Ripple‚Äôs Escrow According to Ripple‚Äôs 2017 statement, the company locked 55 billion XRP into a cryptographically secured escrow system, releasing a maximum of 1 billion XRP per month over 55 months. As Ripple stated, the purpose, was ‚Äúto remove uncertainty around XRP‚Äôs future supply‚Äù and ensure that a large quantity would not enter the market at once, preventing drastic price fluctuations. This strategy was designed to establish predictability in XRP‚Äôs distribution and counter fears of market oversupply. XRP Allocation from Escrow SMQKE‚Äôs post reiterated that the primary use of released XRP is ‚Äúto incentivize market makers for XRP-based currency exchanges and for sales to institutional investors‚Äînot retail.‚Äù This aligns with Ripple‚Äôs original announcement, which stated that XRP would facilitate liquidity by offering ‚Äútighter spreads between currency pairs‚Äù and would also be sold to institutional investors. Unused XRP at the end of each month is returned to escrow, extending the timeline for its eventual release. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 The post directly counters claims that Ripple‚Äôs escrow is a means to dump XRP on retail investors. SMQKE argued that if Ripple were indiscriminately ‚Äúdumping‚Äù XRP from escrow, its price would be significantly lower. The structured and controlled release mechanism prevents sudden supply shocks that could negatively impact XRP‚Äôs market performance. Speculation on XRP‚Äôs Role in Broader Economic Strategy An X user, Wolfemother, commented on the post, speculating on a potential future use case for Ripple‚Äôs escrowed XRP . They proposed that it could be utilized as part of a ‚Äúgovernment‚Äôs strategic crypto reserve,‚Äù suggesting that the total escrowed XRP‚Äîamounting to 37 billion‚Äîcould reach a value of $1,000 per XRP, equating to $37 trillion, roughly aligning with the U.S. national debt. While speculative, such theories reflect ongoing discussions about the long-term implications of Ripple‚Äôs escrow model and whether XRP could help global financial structures. As discussions continue, the system remains a key component of XRP‚Äôs market structure, negating the claims of indiscriminate token sales while also fueling broader speculation about its role in the financial ecosystem. title: Top Cryptos to Watch in 2025: Web3Bay, Pi Coin & More
body: The cryptocurrency market continues to offer exciting opportunities, with various projects showing strong potential for growth. As 2025 unfolds, selecting the right assets could make a significant difference in building a profitable portfolio. While established tokens maintain their dominance, newer projects are introducing compelling solutions that could shape the future of blockchain technology. This guide highlights some of the most promising cryptos for 2025. Each has been analyzed based on recent developments, current performance, and long-term growth potential. From decentralized e-commerce platforms to blockchain protocols advancing decentralization, these are the projects to keep an eye on. 1. Web3Bay: Transforming E-Commerce with Blockchain Web3Bay is revolutionizing online shopping by creating a direct marketplace between buyers and sellers using blockchain technology. By removing intermediaries, the platform reduces transaction costs and enhances user privacy. Its presale has gained significant attention, with the 3BAY token currently priced at $0.00524 in its 5th stage, raising over $1.54 million. Analysts anticipate a launch price of $0.1959, potentially offering early investors a 4,200% return. The roadmap for 2025 outlines several key milestones, including full decentralization by Q4 and the introduction of a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) to involve the community in decision-making. Plans to integrate PayPal and other payment systems are also in motion. With its blend of practical application and strong demand, Web3Bay presents an opportunity for those seeking high-growth potential in the crypto market. 2. Near Protocol: Advancing Blockchain Accessibility Near Protocol (NEAR) continues to innovate, becoming the first non-Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) blockchain to integrate with MetaMask. This connection, facilitated through the NEAR Snap feature, enables seamless account creation and transactions within MetaMask, making blockchain interactions more user-friendly. Currently trading at $3.29 after a slight 2.37% decline, Near Protocol remains focused on scalability and ease of use. With growing adoption in decentralized applications (dApps) and enhanced interoperability, NEAR has the potential to solidify its place among the most promising projects for 2025. 3. Pi Coin: A Community-Powered Ecosystem Pi Coin (PI) has gained attention for its mobile-first mining approach, allowing users to participate in blockchain activities through their smartphones. With a community of over 35 million, Pi Network has generated widespread discussion, particularly following recent speculation about a possible Binance listing. In a community vote on Binance Square, 86.2% of participants supported the listing of PI, although Binance has stated that this is not yet confirmed. Despite its strong user base, potential investors should be mindful of ongoing concerns regarding the project‚Äôs legitimacy. Chinese authorities have issued warnings about possible risks related to data privacy. Those considering Pi Coin should thoroughly research before making investment decisions. 4. Hyperliquid: Innovating Decentralized Trading Hyperliquid (HYPE) is gaining traction in decentralized finance (DeFi) with its perpetual trading platform. Recent upgrades include AI-driven trading tools and zero-slippage order execution, improving efficiency and user experience. Over the past month, HYPE has risen by 23%, fueled by increasing trading volumes and platform enhancements. To further strengthen its position, the Hyperliquid Foundation is addressing transparency concerns regarding validator operations. With advanced trading features and a focus on improving accessibility, Hyperliquid is well-positioned for continued growth in 2025. 5. Chainlink: Leading Cross-Chain Data Integration Chainlink (LINK) remains a key player in the blockchain ecosystem, offering critical services for connecting smart contracts with real-world data. Its oracles facilitate seamless data transfers, supporting numerous decentralized applications. Recent updates have focused on expanding staking options and increasing institutional adoption. Although LINK‚Äôs price has seen an 18% drop, now sitting at $16.43, its fundamental technology remains strong. With continued developments and integrations, Chainlink presents a viable option for those seeking stability and innovation in their crypto portfolio. Final Thoughts Choosing the right cryptocurrencies involves weighing potential growth against associated risks. Web3Bay offers a fresh approach to e-commerce, while Near Protocol‚Äôs technological improvements make blockchain interactions more accessible. Meanwhile, Hyperliquid‚Äôs trading advancements and Chainlink‚Äôs role in data connectivity highlight the broad range of opportunities available. Investors should stay informed and track emerging trends to make strategic decisions. Whether looking for high-growth opportunities or established stability, these projects represent some of the most promising options for 2025. title: Trump advisers start mapping out a plan for a national crypto reserve
body: President Donald Trump‚Äôs administration has officially started executing plans for its federal crypto strategic reserve, and step one is figuring out exactly how much crypto the US government already owns, according to a report from the Journal. A month into a six-month planning phase, Trump‚Äôs interagency working group is reportedly doing a full audit of existing crypto holdings, which include assets seized from criminals. Trump first floated the idea of a government-backed crypto stockpile last summer during his campaign, and in January, he signed an executive order to begin laying the foundation. Bo Hines, executive director of the working group, confirmed the process was underway, saying , ‚ÄúThe first thing we have to do is get an accounting of what the government has. We‚Äôll provide more insight as that continues.‚Äù Trump is expected to give a speech about the initiative on Friday at a White House industry summit, where more details will probably come. White House team counts up government-owned crypto The Justice Department and US Marshals Service oversee billions of dollars in confiscated Bitcoin and other crypto assets, mostly taken from criminals. According to the Justice Department‚Äôs inspector general, Michael E. Horowitz, $18 billion worth of Bitcoin is sitting in government-controlled wallets, though accounting issues have made it unclear how much is actually secured. As part of the new plan, officials are now tallying up these holdings to determine whether they will become part of the official crypto reserve. What‚Äôs still unclear is whether the administration will also buy new crypto for the reserve. If they do, Congress might need to approve large acquisitions. There‚Äôs also the question of who exactly will oversee the stockpile‚Äîwhether the Treasury, the Federal Reserve, or a newly created agency. Right now, no federal entity is set up to manage a crypto reserve of this scale. Trump‚Äôs push for a government crypto reserve has divided analysts and investors alike. Supporters say it could legitimize digital assets and integrate them into the country‚Äôs financial system. Crypto advocates have poured millions into Trump‚Äôs campaign and inauguration in efforts to make the reserve a reality. But critics argue that crypto isn‚Äôt comparable to gold or oil, which are two assets commonly stockpiled by governments. Gene Hoffman, CEO of blockchain firm Chia Network, doesn‚Äôt think the US should be making these calls yet. ‚ÄúThe United States government shouldn‚Äôt be making this call yet,‚Äù he said . Others warn that the extreme volatility of crypto could turn a government reserve into a financial disaster if prices crash. Timothy Massad, former chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, believes Trump‚Äôs plan could be more about paying back campaign supporters than actual financial strategy. ‚ÄúIt concerns me that it is a payback for their support of Trump and the Republican Party,‚Äù Massad said. Meanwhile, Bitcoin momentarily surged 10% after Trump‚Äôs announcement, proving just how much influence he has over the market. Financial advisers in the UK and US are reporting a spike in clients asking about crypto investments. Why people are concerned about Trump‚Äôs crypto plans One of the biggest issues with a government-controlled crypto reserve is security. Crypto is a prime target for hackers, and federal agencies haven‚Äôt always been great at keeping track of what they already have. The US Marshals Service has struggled to manage seized crypto, and with $18 billion in Bitcoin alone, the potential for mismanagement is quite high. Nathan McCauley, CEO of Anchorage Digital warned that security needs to be a top priority. He recommended keeping assets stored in cold wallets with private keys only accessible under strict controls. ‚ÄúThere will need to be some careful consideration about how the Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are held and how they are held securely,‚Äù McCauley said. Cryptos are difficult to safeguard because they are targeted by sophisticated hackers, putting a premium on cybersecurity measures for crypto exchanges and custodians that hold assets. Bybit, one of the world‚Äôs biggest exchanges, recently saw the hacker group Lazarus stole over $1.4 billion in Ethereum from its cold wallets. ‚ÄúCriminals have stolen tokens worth $1.5 billion from the crypto exchange Bybit, prompting a rush of customers demanding their funds back,‚Äù Jochen Stanzl, chief market analyst at CMC Markets, said. He compared it to the final chaotic hours of FTX, where mass withdrawals led to a complete collapse. ‚ÄúAlthough Bybit claims to be stable, the developments evoke memories of the chaotic final hours of the now-defunct FTX exchange.‚Äù Cryptopolitan Academy: Tired of market swings? Learn how DeFi can help you build steady passive income. Register Now

title: Belarus weighs crypto mining as Lukashenko cites U.S. interest in digital reserves
body: The President of Belarus, Aleksandr Lukashenko, suggested that the Eastern European country could begin mining digital assets. ‚ÄúLook at this mining. More and more people are approaching me. If it‚Äôs profitable for us, let‚Äôs do it. We have excess electricity. Let them produce this cryptocurrency and so on,‚Äù Lukashenko told Alexei Kushnarenko, Belarus‚Äôs newly appointed energy minister, as reported by local media outlet Belta. Belarus considers crypto mining amid rising global interest in digital reserves This President of Belarus suggestion emerges as the U.S. government is studying the possibility of creating a national strategic crypto reserve that could include assets such as Bitcoin (BTC), Ether (ETH), Solana (SOL), Ripple (XRP) and Cardano (ADA). Lukashenko acknowledged the White House‚Äôs growing interest in digital assets, stating, ‚ÄúYou see the direction the world is taking, especially the largest economy. They announced yesterday that they will maintain a crypto reserve.‚Äù ‚ÄúTherefore, there will be demand for them. Well, maybe we should do it ourselves,‚Äù Lukashenko said . Belarus wouldn‚Äôt be the first nation to mine digital assets. The Kingdom of Bhutan, with its abundance of hydropower, already has more than 100 megawatts (MW) of operational bitcoin mining infrastructure and is set to get another 500MW worth of power online. The country currently holds $950 million in Bitcoin, according to Arkham Intelligence. El Salvador on the other hand uses geothermal energy to mine Bitcoin, though in smaller quantities. Trump pushes crypto strategy forward with first-ever summit Even with the Trump administration‚Äôs promises and enthusiasm, the industry has been left disappointed by meme coin scandals and a lack of concrete government action‚Äîaside from the dismissal of a few SEC cases and the release of a somewhat ambiguous Executive Order on January 23. That disappointment, however, just got a temporary lift. Two days ago, the White House announced it would hold its first-ever crypto summit this Friday, chaired by White House A.I. & Crypto Czar David Sacks and overseen by Bo Hines, Executive Director of the President‚Äôs Working Group on Digital Assets. Fox Business reporter Eleanor Terrett reports that the roundtable, scheduled from 6:30 pm to 10:30 pm UTC, is expected to include more than 25 participants, including members of the Presidential Working Group on Digital Assets. As of Wednesday morning, Terrett reported that 11 crypto executives and two White House representatives had confirmed their attendance. However, it seems Cardano co-founder Charles Hoskinson is not invited to the Summit on Friday, according to a White House source familiar with the guest list. In fact, neither Hoskinson nor any representatives for Cardano have been invited to meet with the president since the inauguration. Many in the community had also taken X posts from Hoskinson in February to mean he would attend a fundraising dinner for pro-crypto PAC MAGA Inc. this past Saturday. As U.S. President Donald Trump prepares to host the first White House Crypto Summit on March 7, excitement is building within the crypto community. This marks progress toward the Executive Order‚Äôs goals of bolstering U.S. leadership in digital assets and financial technology while safeguarding economic freedom. However, for a president who closely ties stock market performance to his success, the summit‚Äôs announcement alone likely fell short. That may explain why Trump took it a step further, unveiling the first five tokens set to be included in a future crypto reserve: Bitcoin, Ether, Cardano, Ripple, and Solana. Trump‚Äôs social media posts offer little additional detail on the planned ‚Äúreserve,‚Äù as he referred to it in his Sunday posts. However, the choice of the word ‚Äúreserve‚Äù appears to signal a shift from the administration‚Äôs stance in January‚Äôs Executive Order. The term ‚Äúreserve‚Äù suggests that the government will proactively purchase more assets. In contrast, the intention stated in January‚Äôs executive order to ‚Äúevaluate the potential creation and maintenance of a national digital asset stockpile‚Äù would be more about holding onto the $19.1 billion in crypto, 97.9% of which is in Bitcoin, that it already has from seizures across dozens of tokens. title: Investment Giant Franklin Templeton Implied That These Altcoins Are ‚ÄúUndervalued‚Äù And Could Soar
body: Investment giant Franklin Templeton noted in a recent report that there is a significant valuation difference between decentralized finance (DeFi) tokens on the Solana and Ethereum networks. Describing this disparity as ‚Äúvalue asymmetry,‚Äù the report points out that Solana‚Äôs DeFi sector is growing faster and generating more revenue than Ethereum‚Äôs, but its tokens remain relatively undervalued. ‚ÄúSolana DeFi valuation multiples are trading lower than their Ethereum counterparts on average despite their significantly higher growth profiles, highlighting a distinct valuation asymmetry,‚Äù the report said. Franklin Templeton conducted an analysis comparing five leading Ethereum-based DeFi projects (LDO, AAVE, ENA, MKR, and UNI) to five of Solana‚Äôs top-performing protocols (JTO, JUP, KMNO, MNDE, and RAY). The findings showed that Solana projects experienced a staggering 2,400% median growth in fees year-over-year and a median valuation multiple of 9x. In contrast, Ethereum projects saw a more modest growth of 150% and a multiple of 18x. Related News: Analytics Company Shares 7 "Most Negative" Altcoins According to Funding Rates This valuation disparity follows a period of rapid expansion for Solana. The network‚Äôs decentralized exchanges (DEXs) have witnessed a surge in trading activity, led primarily by memecoin investors. In January 2025, Solana‚Äôs DEXs recorded higher trading volumes than the entire Ethereum ecosystem combined. ‚ÄúDeFi may be entering an era of Solana Virtual Machine dominance, moving away from the historical reign of EVM-based DeFi,‚Äù the report said. However, Franklin Templeton clarified that this does not indicate Ethereum‚Äôs decline. Instead, the firm noted that the increased activity on Ethereum‚Äôs layer-2 scaling solutions indicates the strategic evolution of the network. ‚ÄúThe shift of activity to layer-2 blockchains is evidence that the Ethereum scaling approach is advancing incrementally,‚Äù the report said. Despite the current undervaluation of Solana-based DeFi assets, Franklin Templeton predicted that this disparity may not last forever. ‚ÄúAs Solana continues to demonstrate its resilience as a decentralized computing platform, the market may soon price blue-chip, cornerstone Solana DeFi protocols in line with comparable Ethereum protocols,‚Äù the report concluded. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Investment Giant Franklin Templeton Implied That These Altcoins Are ‚ÄúUndervalued‚Äù And Could Soar

title: Billionaire Warns Of Financial Turmoil‚ÄîWill Bitcoin Save Investors?
body: The United States, with its cycle of growing debt and debt servicing, may face a financial crisis in the next few years. Ray Dalio, the billionaire investor and founder of Bridgewater Associates, boldly claims a looming debt crisis and calls it a ‚Äúpotential heart attack.‚Äù In a statement, Dalio argued that once we reach a point in the cycle where one borrows more money to service debt and bond holders say that it‚Äôs risky, it becomes a ‚Äúdebt debt spiral.‚Äù Dalio compares the current debt crisis to a heart attack waiting to happen if authorities fail to provide interventions. Related Reading: Bitcoin ‚ÄòWon‚Äôt Stop At $150K‚Äô This Year, Research Firm Chief Says Understanding The Current US Debt Issue Dalio‚Äôs insights on the current economic landscape and the country‚Äôs looming debt crisis come as the crypto market cap drops to $2.76 trillion in one day. During the market shakeoff this week, the overall crypto market cap dropped by 8%, with Ethereum and Bitcoin leading the losers with 11% and 8%, respectively. The US is currently facing a growing debt and excessive budget deficits. According to recent data, the country‚Äôs national debt is now $33.6 trillion, with a massive deficit of $1.7 trillion in 2023, equal to 5.8% of the total GDP. Researchers are also warning about the increasing cost of servicing the debt, hitting $879 billion in 2023, comparable to the size of the country‚Äôs budget for national defense. Recognize that conflicts are essential for great relationships because they are how people determine whether their principles are aligned and resolve their differences. pic.twitter.com/MbBpHO76mN ‚Äî Ray Dalio (@RayDalio) February 6, 2018 Dalio Says Alternative Stores Of Value Can Help In an interview on the Odds Lots podcast, Dalio offered insights on how the general public responds to an economic crisis. He mentioned that in times of economic uncertainties, many investors are looking at alternative stores of value. Dalio asks: What‚Äôs an alternative to money with a stable supply? He mentioned the growing role of Bitcoin and digital assets as leverage against inflation. ‚ÄúRecognize that conflicts are essential for great relationships because they are how people determine whether their principles are aligned and resolve their differences.‚Äù he added. Dalio‚Äôs insights followed US President Trump‚Äôs announcement on the proposed US strategic reserve, which includes top coins such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, Ripple, and Cardano. Trump‚Äôs statement was followed by a spike in crypto prices, with Bitcoin surging to over $90k after revisiting $80k. While Bitcoin‚Äôs price surged for the day, its dominance dipped from 55.4% to 50%, reflecting the shift in capital to altcoins. Historically, a decline in Bitcoin‚Äôs dominance catalyzes an altcoin run, which now excites many on social media. Is Bitcoin The Answer? Although Ray Dalio didn‚Äôt categorically mention Bitcoin as the ‚Äúpotential savior‚Äù, his recent statements suggest a favorable view on the premier digital asset. Due to its decentralization, Dalio highlighted the asset‚Äôs potential as a hedge against economic uncertainties. Related Reading: Ripple Co-Founder Tied To Untouched XRP Holdings Worth Billions‚ÄîCrypto Sleuth Unlike traditional assets governments can confiscate, Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies work beyond traditional financial mechanisms, promoting wealth preservation. Dalio also acknowledged Bitcoin‚Äôs role, insisting that previous economic crises have shown that these assets, while they struggle, still are able to retain their values. title: Trader Warns XRP Now Flashing Bearish Signal That Preceded Solana and Bitcoin Correction ‚Äì Here‚Äôs His Outlook
body: A crypto strategist who accurately called the Bitcoin ( BTC ) and Solana ( SOL ) correction this year says that the payments altcoin XRP is next in line to witness big price drops. Pseudonymous analyst Bluntz tells his 318,000 followers on the social media platform X that the XRP against Bitcoin (XRP/BTC) pair is flashing a bearish divergence on the weekly chart. Traders keep a close eye on coins flashing a bearish divergence as the signal suggests the token is losing bullish momentum and may be ready to enter a downtrend. Bluntz also notes that XRP appears to be in the midst of an ABC correction against the US dollar. ‚ÄúLooks increasingly like that was a complacency shoulder B wave on XRP in my opinion. If BTC and SOL taught me anything the last month, do not fade the weekly bear divs.‚Äù Source: Bluntz/X Bluntz practices the Elliott Wave theory, which states that an asset tends to go through an ABC pullback after completing a five-wave rally. Based on the trader‚Äôs chart, he seems to predict that XRP will fall to the $1 area to complete the ABC correction. At time of writing, XRP is worth $2.46. In January, when BTC was trading above $100,000, Bluntz said that Bitcoin appears to have completed a five-wave rally and that a market top may be in. He later updated his outlook and said that Bitcoin was flashing a bearish divergence on the monthly timeframe. Last month, he told his followers that SOL looked weak after losing the $220 level while showing a bearish divergence on the two-week chart. At time of writing, BTC is trading for $87,421 and SOL is worth $144.78.
